item.description:
Pick your own apples at a local working farm managed by the City of Peabody. Brooksby Farm is an 8 Â½ acre farm with hiking trails that are available to use for free. Take in the warm inviting atmosphere and visit the on-site bakery for delicious cider donuts, hot mulled cider, cold cider or coffee.
TC; Catherine Cantrell, backpackingranny@hotmail.com
RSVP: To he trip coordinator, Rich at the email address listed above
MEET: 10:30 AM. Plan to meet in the parking lot at the entrance to the Barn.
Cost: Free except for the apples that you pick plus $5 that will be credited towards your $25 mmbership when you join Mosaic of MA.
For directions check & information on the apples that are in season and driving directions call Brooksby Farm at (978) 531-7546 or go to: www.essexheritage.org/sites/brooksby_farm.shtml
item.how_to_find_us: Contact the trip's leaderRichard Kline, Richard.Kline@ngc.com for the details

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: APPLE PICKING IN PEABODY at Brooksby Farms
